Post.title: Create git repo in vps
Post._content:
# In VPS 
## new user []

```
# root
useradd git[or other name you like]
passwd git 
```

## Install git 

CentOS/Fedora: `yum install git`
Ubuntu/Debian: `apt-get install git`

## Add SSH key

```
cat .ssh/id_rsa.pub | ssh user@ip "cat >> ~/.ssh/authorized_keys"
```
, ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub~/.ssh/authorized_keys XD

## init git
```
git init --bare repo-name.git
```

, , ...

# In local

## 
banwagonVPS, git22. ~/.ssh/config
```
Host ip[or domain]
Port 
```

## init gitremote
```
git remote set-url origin [user]@[ip]:[repo-name.git]
# pushurl
git push --set-upstream origin master
```
GitOK

Post.title: Gitlab-runner-wechat-miniprogram
Post._content:
- [ Gitlab-runner ](https://docs.gitlab.com/runner/install/osx.html)

-  token

   settings -> CI/CD -> Runners -> Set up a specific Runner manually  token
  ![image](/uploads/2c659316686e8d652c566d3aae36be85/image.png)

-  gitlab-runner
  ```
  #  `gitlab-runner register`, 

  Please enter the gitlab-ci coordinator URL (e.g. https://gitlab.com/):
  # https://gitlab.com/
  Please enter the gitlab-ci token for this runner:
  # token
  Please enter the gitlab-ci description for this runner:
  # 
  Please enter the gitlab-ci tags for this runner (comma separated):
  # , .gitlab-ci.yml, 
  # mac
  Please enter the executor: docker-ssh, parallels, shell, virtualbox, docker+machine, docker, ssh, docker-ssh+machine,
   kubernetes:
  # shell
  Registering runner... succeeded
   ```
-  .gitlab-ci.yml, 
  ```
	image: node:alpine

	before_script:
	    - export APP_ENV=testing
	    - yarn config set registry 'https://registry.npm.taobao.org'
	stages:
	    - build
	    - deploy

	variables:
	    NPM_CONFIG_CACHE: "/cache/npm"
	    YARN_CACHE_FOLDER: "/cache/yarn"
	    DOCKER_DRIVER: overlay2
	build-package:
	    stage: build
	    dependencies: []
	    cache:
	      key: "$CI_COMMIT_REF_NAME"
	      policy: pull
	      paths:
	        - node_modules
	    script:
        #        
        #        - PORT=`cat ~/Library/Application\ Support/web/Default/.ide`
        #        - curl http://127.0.0.1:$PORT/buildnpm?projectpath=$PWD\&compiletype=miniprogram
        #        
	        - if [ ! -d "node_modules" ]; then
	        - yarn install --cache-folder /cache/yarn
	        - fi
	        - yarn build
	        - cp ./project.config.json ./dist/project.config.json
	    artifacts:
	        name: "wxpkg-dlkhgl-$CI_COMMIT_TAG"
	        untracked: false
	        paths:
	            - dist
	    only:
	        - tags
            # tagrunner

	    tags:
	        - docker
            # tagregisttag, scirpt
	deploy:
	    stage: deploy
	    dependencies:
	        - build-package
	    variables:
	        GIT_STRATEGY: none
	    before_script: []
	    script:
	        # HTTP, 
	        - PORT=`cat ~/Library/Application\ Support/web/Default/.ide`
	        # API
	        - curl http://127.0.0.1:$PORT/upload\?projectpath\=$PWD/dist\&version\=$CI_COMMIT_TAG\&desc\=audo-deploy
	        - echo success
	    only:
	        - tags
	    tags:
	        - mac
  ```

- , 
![image](/uploads/6073caecada64c62b4dbe59dc0f4d380/image.png)

- pipline

  pipline
![image](/uploads/d42f4045dafd09eb2013fd22a244f59b/image.png)

Post.title: ASCII Art:Graph::Easy
Post._content:
## install
#### MAC

    -> brew install graphviz 
    -> cpan
    -> install Graph::Easy
#### Windows
 - install graphviz([graphviz](http://www.graphviz.org/))
 - install perl([perl](http://www.perl.org/))
 - install cpan([cpan](http://www.cpan.org/modules/INSTALL.html))
 - install Graph::Easy by cpan

## Use

    graph-easy someDSL.txt
## Grammer
#### annotations

    # annotation
    #illegal annotation
    #FFFFFF # color
    \#transferred meaning
#### Node

    [single node]
    [node a],[node b]
#### Edges
 

    1. ->
    2. =>
    3. .>
    4. ~>
    5. .->
    6. ..->
    7. = >
    8. - >

add label:

    [ node a] - label ->[node b]
result:

    +--------+  request   +--------+
    | client | ---------> | server |
    +--------+            +--------+

#### Attributes

    {attribute: value}

#### Samples

Table:
[VER|NMETHODS|METHODS||1|1|1 to 255]

result:

    +-----+----------+----------+
    | VER | NMETHODS |  METHODS |
    +-----+----------+----------+
    |  1  |     1    | 1 to 255 |
    +-----+----------+----------+

   --------------
    
   > [](http://bloodgate.com/perl/graph/manual/index.html)
   > [](https://weishu.gitbooks.io/graph-easy-cn/content/overview/index.html)  ---  weishu

Post.title: iTerm
Post._content:
## install
```
brew install privoxy
```

## config
```
# listen-address 0.0.0.0 
# listen-address 127.0.0.1 
# :8118 HTTP
echo 'listen-address 127.0.0.1:8118\nforward-socks5 / localhost:1080 .' >> /usr/local/etc/privoxy/config
```

## start service
```
sudo /usr/local/sbin/privoxy /usr/local/etc/privoxy/config
```

## check is start success
```
netstat -na | grep 8118
```

if:
```
tcp4 0   0  *.8118       *.*     LISTEN
```
then success

else: fail

## debug
```
# show log
cat /usr/local/var/log/privoxy/logfile
```
### Can't bind
```
Fatal error: can't bind to x.x.x.x:xxxx: Can't assign requested address
```

then check is the ip address right. []

### Port be taken
```
Fatal error: can't bind to 127.0.0.1:8118: There may be another Privoxy or some other proxy running on port 8118
```

then change port to 8119 or other availiable port

## Add switcher

```
# ~/.bash_profile Add follow

function proxy_off(){
    unset http_proxy
    unset https_proxy
    echo -e "Proxy off"
}
function proxy_on() {
    export no_proxy="localhost,127.0.0.1,localaddress,.localdomain.com"
    export http_proxy="http://127.0.0.1:8118"
    export https_proxy=$http_proxy
    echo -e "Proxy on"
}

```

Update config
```
source ~/.bash_profile
```

## Open proxy

```
proxy_on
```

## Check proxy
```
curl ip.gs
```

IPSSIP then hooray!!!!

TCP/IP: 80, 
```
            request
           --------->
HOST                     CLIENT
           <--------- 
            response
```

```
http://www.domain.com:1234/path/to/resource?a=b&x=y
----   -------------- ----                  -------
  |           |         |                       |
protecol     host      port                   query
```

### protecol:

- http
- https
- ftp
- smtp
....

### Verbs:

- GET , 
- POST , 
- PUT , 
- DELETE 
- TRACE 
- OPTIONS

### Status Codes:

- 1xx: informational msg
- 2xx: 
 - 200: OK
 - 204: No Content
 - 205: Reset Content
 - 206: Partial Content
- 3xx: 
 - 304: Not Modified
- 4xx: 
 - 401: 
 - 403: 
 - 405: (GET->POST)
 - 404: 
 - 409: Conflict
- 5xx: 

### http vs https
```
    **http**            **https**

    HTTP                  HTTP
    TCP                   SSL or TLS
    IP                    TCP
                          IP                   
```

### 
```
                    
 +-----------+     B                     D  Process
 |    Host   |      +-----------+         +----------+
 +-----------+      |           |         |          |
                    |           |         |          |
                    |           |         |          |
                    |           |         |          |
                    |           |         |          |
                    |           |         |          |
 +-----------+      |           |         |          |
 |  Client   |      |  connect  |         | request  |
 +-----------+    A +          C+---------+          +------->     ------->
                DNS lookup                          E   response   F close
```

- A: dnsip
- A->C: 
- C->D: 
- D: 
- D->E: 
- F: 

### http

- HTTP/1.0: 
- HTTP/1.1: 
  parallel connections + persistent connections

### 

- Request Headers
- Client-IP
- Fat Urls
- Cookies

### http

Request line  POST /path/to/server/file HTTP/1.1
Headers       Host: www.abc.com:8080
              Content-Length: 25
Empty line
Body(opt)     Must match Content-Length

### 

```
Web Browser                                  Web Server
                    GET /some/file
request      ------------------------------>

                     401 Unauthrized
             <------------------------------
enter             www-Authenticate:Basic...
user&pwd                 
                     GET /some/file
              ------------------------------>
                  Authorized:Basic ....

                          201 OK
              <------------------------------
                   <html>Hello..</html>
```

### 

Caching(Browser)

- Last-Modified
- ETag
- Expires
- Max-Age

Cache-control(Server)

- public
- private
- no-cache

Post.title: Bash
Post._content:
-  `#!/bin/bash`

## 

### 

test.sh 
```
#!/bin/bash
cp $1 $2
```

$1 , $2 
: `bash test.sh test1.sh`
$1test.sh, $2test1.sh

:

- $0 - 
zerotest.sh
```
#!/bin/bash
echo $0
```
`bash zerotest.sh`

: 
```
zerotest.sh
```

- $1 - $9 - 
- $# - 
- $@ - 
- $? - The exit status of the most recently run process.
- $$ - The process ID of the current script.
- $USER - The username of the user running the script.
- $HOSTNAME - The hostname of the machine the script is running on.
- $SECONDS - The number of seconds since the script was started.
- $RANDOM - Returns a different random number each time is it referred to.
- $LINENO - Returns the current line number in the Bash script.

### 

In:
```
var=Hello
varone='Hello World'
vartwo="More $myvar"
varthree='More $myvar'
varfour=Hello World

echo $var
echo $varone
echo $vartwo
echo $varthree
```
Out:
```
Hello
Hello World
More Hello World
More $myvar
# , 
-bash: World: command not found
```

- 
In:
```
myvar=$( ls /etc | wc -l )
echo the value of myvar: $myvar
```
Out:
```
the value of myvar: 87
```

### 

In:
script0.sh
```
#!/bin/bash
var1=blah
var2=foo
echo $0 : var1 -> $var1, var2 -> $var2
export var1
./script1.sh
echo $0 : var1 -> $var1, var2 -> $var2
```
script1.sh
```
#!/bin/bash
echo $0 :: var1 : $var1, var2 : $var2
var1=flop
var2=bleh
```

Out:
```
script0.sh :: var1 : blah, var2 : foo
script1.sh :: var1 : blah, var2 :
script0.sh :: var1 : blah, var2 : foo
```

### 
```
read name 
read name age birthday # 
read -p 'Username:' uservar # 
read -sp 'Password:' passvar # ()
```

## 

### let

```
#!/bin/bash
let a=5+4
echo $a # 9
let "a = 5 + 4"
echo $a # 9
let a++
echo $a # 10
let "a = 4 * 5"
echo $a # 20
let "a = $1 + 30"
echo $a # 30 + first command line argument
```

### expr
 echo let, 
```
#!/bin/bash
expr 5 + 4 # 9
expr "5 + 4" # "5 + 4"
expr 5+4 # 5+4
expr 5 \* $1 # \*
expr 11 % 2 # mod
a=$( expr 10 - 3 )
echo $a # 7
```

### $(())

```
a=$((3+5)) # 
echo $a # 8
```

### ${var}
var('#'markdown....)

## 


### if
```
if [ <some test> ]
then
	<commands>
	# break/continue
elif [ <some test> ] 
then
	<different commands>
else
	<other commands>
fi
```

### switch
```
case <variable> in
	<pattern 1>)
		<commands>
		;;
	<pattern 2>)
		<other commands>
		;;
	*)
		;; # default
esac
```

### while
```
while [ <some test> ]
do
	<commands>
done
```

### until
```
until [ <some test> ]
do
	<commands>
done
```

while  until Java while do  do while

### for
```
for var in <list>
do
	<commands>
done
```
: `for i in $path/*; do`

### range

In:
```
echo {1..5}
echo {10..0..2} # 2
```

Out:
```
1 2 3 4 5
10 8 6 4 2 0
```

### select
In:
```
select_example.sh
#!/bin/bash
names='Kyle Cartman Stan Quit'
PS3='Select character: '
select name in $names
	do
		if [ $name == 'Quit' ]
		then

## 

### /etc/init.d/aria2c

```

#!/bin/sh 
### BEGIN INIT INFO 
# Provides:          aria2 
# Required-Start:    $remote_fs $network 
# Required-Stop:     $remote_fs $network 
# Default-Start:     2 3 4 5 
# Default-Stop:      0 1 6 
# Short-Description: Aria2 Downloader 
### END INIT INFO 
case "$1" in 
	start) 
		echo "Starting aria2c..." 
		sudo -u pi aria2c --conf-path=/etc/aria2/aria2.conf -D 
		;;
	stop) 
		echo "Stopping aria2c..." 
		killall aria2c 
		;; 
	restart) 
	$0 stop && sleep 3 && $0 start 
	;; 
esac 
exit 
```

## 

### /etc/init.d/aria2c

```

#!/bin/sh 
### BEGIN INIT INFO 
# Provides:          aria2 
# Required-Start:    $remote_fs $network 
# Required-Stop:     $remote_fs $network 
# Default-Start:     2 3 4 5 
# Default-Stop:      0 1 6 
# Short-Description: Aria2 Downloader 
### END INIT INFO 
case "$1" in 
	start) 
		echo "Starting aria2c..." 
		sudo -u pi aria2c --conf-path=/etc/aria2/aria2.conf -D 
		;;
	stop) 
		echo "Stopping aria2c..." 
		killall aria2c 
		;; 
	restart) 
	$0 stop && sleep 3 && $0 start 
	;; 
esac 
exit 
```

### 
```
sudo chmod +x /etc/init.d/aria2c
```

### 
```
sudo update-rc.d aria2c defaults
```

--------------------------
==
Echo->[How to Build YourOwn Amazon Echo](http://lifehacker.com/how-to-build-your-own-amazon-echo-with-a-raspberry-pi-1787726931)

--------------------------

# In First Terminal windows
```
cd ~/Desktop/alexa-avs-sample-app/samples
cd companionService && npm start
```

# Second Terminal
```
cd ~/Desktop/alexa-avs-sample-app/samples
cd javaclient && mvn exec:exec
```
**Click Yes** and than **DO NOT** click Ok yet.
Login to Amazon balabala...
after seen "device tokens ready"
click THE OK.

# Third Terminal
```
cd to samples path
cd wakeWordAgent/src && ./wakeWordAgent -e kitt_ai
```

---------    **ALL DONE**     --------------

Post.title: Ubuntu
Post._content:
# oh-my-zsh
- Install zsh first
```
sudo apt-get install zsh
```
- Install OMZ
```
sh -c "$(wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/robbyrussell/oh-my-zsh/master/tools/install.sh -O -)"
```
- set zsh as default
```
chsh -s $(which zsh)
```
Or
```
sudo vi /etc/passwd
```
Find the line:
```
username:x:some-number:some-number:Your-name:/home/username:/bin/bash
```
and replace bash with zsh

# Rime
# Shadowsocks
# Git
## config
```
git config --global user.email "my-email"
git config --global user.name "my-name"
```
## Use ssh
```
mkdir ~/.ssh
chmod 700 ~/.ssh
ssh-keygen -t rsa
```
and add the new SSH key to github

### Callable -> Runnable

```
Future = ExecutorService.submit(Callable)
Future.get() // 
```

### 


 -

### 
 - volatile: 
 - synchronized: 
 	- monitor:  monitor  synchronized   synchronized A()  synchronized B()  monitor  A() B() 
 - lock: /
 - Atomic Java `AtomicInt`  `int++`  `AtomicInt.getAndIncrement()`


### 
```
class SingleMan {
  private static volatile SingleMan sInstance; //  volatile 

  private SingleMan() {
  }

  static SingleMan newInstance() {
    if (sInstance == null) { 
      synchronized (SingleMan.class) { //  synchronized 
        if (sInstance == null) {
          sInstance = new SingleMan();
        }
      }
    }
    return sInstance;
  }
}

```

## 

- thread.stop() 
  `deprecated` , 
- thread.interrupt()
   `isInterrupted()` 
  `sleep` `InterruptedException` 
- monitor.wait()/monitor.notify()/monitor.notifyAll()
  * /monitor
  --> monitor.wait() // 
  --> monitor.notify() // 
    --> monitor.notifyAll() // 
  -->  
  ```
  
     waiting           
                       
              
    thread.notify()          
              
          
                                
          
     queuing                   
                               
                              
          
                                
          
     running                   
                
     thread.wait()
        
  
  ```
- thread.join()
  thread
  ```
  thread1 = { 
    sleep(3000)
    print("thread1 ended")
  }
  thread1.start()
  thread2 = {
    thread1.join() 
    print("thread2 ended") // thread1
  }
  thread1.start()
  ==========================
  
  thread1 ended
  thread2 ended
  ```
- thread.yield()
